meaningMnemonic: The kanji means <kanji>manage</kanji>, but when you manage something, what are you usually managing? How about a business? So this word means <vocabulary>to run a business</vocabulary> even though the kanji is manage.
readingMnemonic: Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: You have <vocabulary>to run a business</vocabulary>. Your business is to make people eat who don't want to eat. "HEY, YOU <reading>EAT NO</reading>W!" (いとな).
